intro: Pisonia nitida var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved pisonia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly the Caribbean and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing as a shrub or small tree. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
